0.title: CHANGELOG
0.content: All notable user-facing changes to this project are documented in this file.

2.title: Frequently Asked Questions
2.content: Here is a list of common questions, and their quick answers. | Frequently Asked Questions . | How do I keep leovim alongside my own configuration? | Why does yanking not sync with my system’s clipboard? | How do I see which plugins are installed? | How do I compile a LaTeX document? | Why is my latex document not compiling? | Why can’t I see my LaTeX document rendered? | Why do you use X plugin and not Y plugin I prefer? | . | .

3.title: How do I keep leovim alongside my own configuration?
3.content: Neovim lets you lauch it with a different configuration file by using the NVIM_APPNAME environmental variable when launching it with the command. NVIM_APPNAME="leovim" nvim . This will look for a configuration file under ~/.config/leovim . Using this, you can clone . git clone https://github.com/leogabac/leovim.git ~/.config/leovim . and make the alias . alias leovim='NVIM_APPNAME="leovim" nvim' . Then leovim will launch this confguration while nvim will keep your default.

4.title: Why does yanking not sync with my system’s clipboard?
4.content: To yank to your system’s clipboard you need to yank it to the + or * register. This can be done with the motion . "+y . If it does not work, make sure to have a clipboard manager like xclip (For X11) or wl-copy (For Wayland) installed.

5.title: How do I see which plugins are installed?
5.content: Leovim uses lazy.nvim as its plugin manager. To see which packages are installed, run . :Lazy .

6.title: How do I compile a LaTeX document?
6.content: Leovim uses vimtex for LaTeX support. The default command for compilation is . :VimtexCompile . This will compile the document, references and all of the necessary dependencies. Then it will launch the default PDF viewer. This command is also mapped to . <leader>ll .

7.title: Why is my latex document not compiling?
7.content: Make sure to have a LaTeX distribution installed, I recommend texlive. Additionally, make sure to have the package latexmk installed as it is the default recipe for continuous compilation.

8.title: Why can’t I see my LaTeX document rendered?
8.content: By default, leovim uses zathura, a PDF viewer meant to work with LaTeX documents. Make sure to have it installed and in your PATH with some optional dependencies like zathura-pdf-mupdf .

9.title: Why do you use X plugin and not Y plugin I prefer?
9.content: Because people can actually have different opinions.

17.title: leovim
17.content: Leo’s neovim configuration. Get started now View it on GitHub . There is a lot of missing documentation. Work in progress. Welcome to leovim. At first I made it for myself when I wanted to heavily modify the behavior of my Neovim distribution at the time, after changing too much, I decided to make my own configuration. This is not a neovim distribution, but a template that you can use, modify, and make your own. In fact, I encourage you to keep and use this configuration along your own. To do this, go to the FAQ section.

19.title: Getting started
19.content: Requirements . Mandatory . | neovim > 0.10.0 | . Optional . | A latex distribution, like texlive with the latexmk package. | Formatters like prettier. | . Installation . Clone the repopository . git clone https://github.com/leogabac/leovim.git ~/.config/nvim . and launch . nvim . Documentation . To see what all of the plugins leovim has, and how to work with some of them, you can go to the Documentation. License . Leovim is distributed by an MIT license. Thank you to the contributors of leovim! . | | .

23.title: Recommended LSPs
23.content: . | C: clangd | Python: pylsp | Lua: lua_ls | Markdown: marksman | Rust: rust_analyzer | .
